intro: Dioscorea biserialis, commonly known as the biserial yam, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are the primary edible part. The plant produces small, green, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. Its tubers are often used in traditional cuisines and have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. The species is also of interest in agricultural research due to its adaptability and nutritional value.
